unnormalised: **Rental Agreements: Are You Paying Attention, Yaar?**
normalised: **Rental Agreements: Are You Paying Attention, Yaar?**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 - So you've finally found that perfect flat in Bandra, just like in a Karan Johar film, but hold on! Before you start picturing chai with SRK on your balcony, have you actually *read* your rental agreement?
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six - So you've finally found that perfect flat in Bandra, just like in a Karan Johar film, but hold on! Before you start picturing chai with S R K on your balcony, have you actually *read* your rental agreement?

unnormalised: Turns out, a lot of folks are just skimming these crucial documents. Experts at the National Housing Bank (NHB) are urging renters, especially first-timers, to be extra diligent.
normalised: Turns out, a lot of folks are just skimming these crucial documents. Experts at the N H B are urging renters, especially first-timers, to be extra diligent.

unnormalised: Things to look out for? The lock-in period (usually 11 months), the security deposit amount (can be a hefty Rs. 50,000 or more!), and rules about repairs. Is that leaky tap *your* problem or the landlord's?
normalised: Things to look out for? The lock-in period (usually eleven months), the security deposit amount (can be a hefty rupee fifty thousand or more!), and rules about repairs. Is that leaky tap *your* problem or the landlord's?

unnormalised: Also, be crystal clear about rent increases. Are they capped at 5% annually or can your landlord suddenly demand an extra Rs. 5,000 next year?
normalised: Also, be crystal clear about rent increases. Are they capped at five percent annually or can your landlord suddenly demand an extra rupee five thousand next year?

unnormalised: Don't be shy to negotiate, too! Many landlords are flexible, especially if you’re a good tenant. Remember, a little bit of reading can save you a whole lot of headache (and money!) down the line. Happy renting!
normalised: Don't be shy to negotiate, too! Many landlords are flexible, especially if you’re a good tenant. Remember, a little bit of reading can save you a whole lot of headache (and money!) down the line. Happy renting!
